text: Balistomorphus ovalis is an extinct, prehistoric triggerfish that lived during the early Oligocene epoch in what is now the canton of Glarus, Switzerland. == Description == This fish had a lot of similarities to the modern-day triggerfish, including the placement of the eyes. == References == # Sepkoski, Jack (2002). "A compendium of fossil marine animal genera". Bulletins of American Paleontology. 364: 560. Archived from the original on 2011-07-23. Retrieved 2009-02-27. # "Balistomorphus Posters for Sale". Redbubble. Category:Tetraodontiformes Category:Ray-finned fish Category:Extinct fish
title: Balistomorphus
